qas.question: How many years old were the Quran fragments discovered in Birmingham in 2015?
What script were the Birmingham Quran fragments written in?
Which modern script descends from the script on the Birmingham Quran fragments?
What feature of the Birmingham Quran fragments' text make some doubt that it is older than other known versions of the Quran?
How many years old were the Quran fragments discovered in Birmingham in 1915?
How many years old were the Quran fragments lost in Birmingham in 2015?
What script weren't the Birmingham Quran fragments written in?
Which unmodern script descends from the script on the Birmingham Quran fragments?
What feature of the Birmingham Quran fragments' text make some doubt that it is newer than other known versions of the Quran?

context: In 2015, fragments of a very early Quran, dating back to <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>1370<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> years ago, were discovered in the library of the University of Birmingham, England. According to the tests carried out by Oxford University Radiocarbon Accelerator Unit, "with a probability of more than 95%, the parchment was from between 568 and 645". The manuscript is written in <a1_0><b6_0>Hijazi<b6_0/><a1_0/> script, an early form of written <a2_0><b7_0>Arabic<b7_0/><a2_0/>. This is possibly the earliest extant exemplar of the Quran, but as the tests allow a range of possible dates, it cannot be said with certainty which of the existing versions is the oldest. Saudi scholar Saud al-Sarhan has expressed doubt over the age of the fragments as they contain <a3_0><b8_0>dots and chapter separators<b8_0/><a3_0/> that are believed to have originated later.
